author: Bobby Quinn
title: paypixl - Validating Drone Metadata
description: Customers ordering drone imagery need to validate the metadata of collected drone imagery to ensure images weren't edited or modified.

assessments.note: Using the blockchain to provide immutable time/date and location stamping on aerial photography provides a compelling use case

The proposal has the potential to provide a source of revenge to photographers and videographers in general. Not only for drone imagery. The issue being addresses have a good market with a global reach and had potential to be catalysis in monitising other NFTs.

This proposal leverages the metadata-recording functionality of the Cardano blockchain, with a novel and niche set of data. Drone imagery, uses and business mechanics is not familiar to anyone but the proposer has presented a valid use case that could help expand Cardano reach in an unexpected industry. That said, the immutability of the metadata in Cardano could only be reliably trusted if there is a secure way of ensuring the cloud-stored (off-chain) file it's purportedly matched with, is itself immutable. The solution does not seem to address the fact that the data outside of Cardano would still be open to manipulation.

The proposal addresses the Fund 5 Metadata challenge very well. The problem is identified and described subjectively. The solution is well-identified but needs more description on scalability and how it will benefit the Cardano Community. Suggestion: This project can utilize the power of the Cardano Blockchain and can also integrate ADA pay for payment between buyer and seller of the drone imagery on the Paypixl marketplace

This is an interesting use case of metadata that fits well the challenge, namely as a way to prove of time/date of images and their authenticity. This would make the company stand-out by offering a unique authentication solutions to customers and a good use case-study of Cardano.

The proposal directly addresses the challenge's use case of proving that a specific document existed at a particular time. The approach blends the use of a centralized database for efficiency with the immutability of UTxO metadata. However, the approach only assures that the imagery, documents, and metadata weren't altered after their were registered on the blockchain: i.e., it doesn't prevent alteration of the drone data or metadata prior to ingestion in the paypixl system. (Such would only be possible if drone hardware components "signed" the imagery and metadata.)
Proposer already working on the marketplace and has experience in both the aerial photography and blockchain spaces

The proposal claims to be backed by Raven Spatial which has products involving Drone imagery. Details of the people in Raven is available on the internet. The credentials of the people can be established and are likely to be capable of implementing the proposal in right earnest.

The attached document lists all the technical elements that would make this model work. However, it lacks  details in terms of resources, timelines and costing to provide more confidence of how the project's life will proceed. The experience of the proposer is clear with the provision of the currently live paypixl site, but the type of work and how it will be approached is not included. This proposal will benefit greatly if an itemised dev path is presented.

There is a vast potential to grow metadata transactions by creating drone imagery and a service marketplace. This proposal has enormous potential but needs details on the team. Who will implement this proposal and the team's relevant experience? How do you plan to market this project once completed? How long will it take to build? Think of How do you plan to overcome the challenges of making this metadata application? Will you be working on it by yourself, or do you have a team? You can break down the final product into deliverable steps and include it in a roadmap.

At the very least a summary of the plan should have been presented here, having to open a scroll trough an attachment will likely deter some voters. Attachments should only be used as a supplement. Saying that the document explain well the  "why" and "how" paypixl intends to integrate Cardano into its service. It's difficult to determine what is the role of each of the proposers and what is their experience, specially in the area of Blockchain development. Just adding CV detailing past experience and what masters course the proposer is enrolled in would add to the proposal. The plan lacks a few details such as a budget breakdown, and a implementation timeline, that voters would expect to see.

The proposal team has demonstrated experience with both imagery and blockchain, and the proposal evidences detailed understanding of Cardano components. However, the proposal does not outline an actual plan (aside from justifying technology and design choices) and does not include a timeline roadmap: rather, it presents static design diagrams, lists of requirements, and the components of the software stack. Not presenting a viable, staged, sequence of activities and discussing risks makes it difficult to have full confidence in successful execution.

One question I have is regarding when the photography is getting linked to the blockchain. Ideally it would be directly from the drone with GPS location and date/time stamps. Thi sseem unlikely as I doubt the drone would be directly connected to the blockchain. If the images are only linked to the blockchain once downloaded from the drone, this allows for tampering with the location and timestamp data. Does the proposer have a solution for this?
The proposal is simple and aims to implement a straightforward application of metadata/NFT. It has sufficient details is included less a roadmap and deliverable timeframe.

The listing of the products that will interact with Cardano in order for the business model to work is clearly defined, however, timelines and targets for each product; SDK + API + CLI, etc is not provided and would make it a little difficult for this project to audit. It would be nice to see the timelines associated with the development of each item in order to enable validation of the requested funds and ensure traceability of the project going forward.

The proposal doesn't include any roadmap, milestones, or KPI's. Please make sure to include a roadmap and Key Performance Metrics. This way, the community will know what to expect out of the delivery of the project. Think of describing the major steps to complete this project fully. What is the project plan of this proposal? and include KPI's (Describe and factor in How many by when formula)

Given that there are no milestones, road-map or KPI's  presented it will be difficult, if not impossible for the community to audit the progress and success of the proposal. These are the main lacking features of this proposal

Because the proposal does not include a staged or time-based plan with intermediate milestones or deliverables, it would be difficult to measure progress beyond simply cataloging which parts of the proposal's block diagrams were nominally complete. Final success would be measurable against the requirements stated in the proposal. This might result in a situation were the proposal could only be semi-quantitatively audited near its final stage, and not in early stages.

solution: Use a hybrid blockchain + traditional data send method to send/receive images and supporting documents with blockchain metadata validation.
experience: 15 years aerial and satellite imagery acquisition, 7 years combined in blockchain, currently completing a Masters in Blockchain Technology
